programme.title: Grâce à Dieu
programme.desc: Three men abused by the same priest as boys begin a fight to expose him.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening (Letter G) S1 (7/25)
programme.desc: «Letter G»Carol explores subjects that all begin with the letter G.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's a good time to get tender plants in the ground now the risk of frost has passed. Monty is busy planting out tropical gingers and sweetcorn and direct sowing beans. Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, designed and planted by owners who love to recycle and repurpose as much as they can. Rekha Mistry shares the secrets of her success for growing aubergines on her London allotment. There's a re-visit to farmer turned nurseryman Barry Proctor as he makes final preparations for his first RHS Chelsea Flower Show. And to coincide with Mental Health Awareness Week, journalist Rosie Kinchen explains how horticulture helped her deal with postnatal depression. Plus, more of the films that have been sent in by viewers.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team explores initiatives helping people to improve their mental wellbeing.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Beechgrove Garden is planning for a colourful summer, planting for pollinators and caring for dahlias. Kirsty Wilson and Lizzie Schofield will have the usual half hour of great gardening advice, including a follow-up on how the dahlia tubers planted in pots in April are coming on, and what to do if you want to get some free plants by taking dahlia cuttings. Kirsty is sowing a bed around the viburnum that was moved last autumn, and this new area will be home to plants that are particularly good for pollinators. Calum Clunie will be sending an update from his allotment in Fife, and George Anderson is in Joppa. And it's the start of a garden renovation for a family who have recently moved into a new-build house.

programme.title: Landward (7/26)
programme.desc: Dougie visits a family farm near Torrance making succession plans for the next generation.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: The best bits and favourite moments from Saturday Kitchen.

programme.title: The Big Family Cooking Showdown S2
programme.desc: The three remaining families face a surprise head-to-head challenge for which they have to nominate one family member to cook on their own. There are pastry disasters, a fruit controversy and raw egg whites as the cooks tackle a lemon meringue pie. For the second task, the families are reunited to make a two-course meal with lamb and almonds as the star ingredients. The pressure is on as only two families can make it through to the week's play-offs.

programme.title: Chelsea v Arsenal
programme.desc: Chelsea play Arsenal in the Women's Super League.

programme.title: Castleford Tigers v Hull FC
programme.desc: Castleford Tigers face Hull FC in rugby league's most prestigious knockout competition for the fifth time in nine seasons, with this tie followed by the quarter-final draw. Hull won the previous four Challenge Cup encounters and narrowly held off a stunning Castleford fightback to beat them 32-30 on the opening weekend of the current Super League campaign. Can recently appointed Castleford head coach Andy Last mastermind a win against the club where he played and coached? Dave Woods provides the match commentary.

programme.title: Flog It ! S13
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Wallasey Town Hall on the banks of the River Mersey. Antiques experts Philip Serrell and Nick Davies get to meet people from all over Merseyside who have brought in their antiques and collectibles to receive a valuation. Paul gets special permission to go behind the scenes with National Museums Liverpool to find out how they preserve the millions of often priceless objects that are in their care at the Conservation Studios in the city centre. Paul also heads to the stately grandeur of Dunham Massey, which was a military hospital during the First World War. He explores an ambitious project which brings that significant time back to life.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy (Naples and the Amalfi Coast) S1 (1/6)
programme.desc: «Naples and the Amalfi Coast»Stanley Tucci feasts on pizza in Naples.

programme.title: Inside the Factory (Ice Cream)
programme.desc: «Ice Cream»Gregg visits a factory that churns out fifty thousand litres of dairy ice cream every day.

programme.title: Les hôtels les plus incroyables du monde (Nimb Hotel, Copenhagen) S4 (4/6)
programme.desc: «Nimb Hotel, Copenhagen»Monica and Giles travel to a hotel in Copenhagen that aims to deliver complete happiness.

programme.title: Simon Reeve's South America S1 (3/5)
programme.desc: Simon travels through the high Andes mountains from Peru to Bolivia.

programme.title: Supernova
programme.desc: C'est l'histoire émouvante d'un homme qui s'efforce de profiter du reste de sa vie, un véritable ''carpe diem''.

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes Almost Australian (Mateship) S1 (2/3)
programme.desc: «Mateship»In a bid to understand the Australian cultural artefact that is mateship, Miriam meets non-Aboriginal and Aboriginal Australians to see if this idea of universal friendship holds true in reality.

programme.title: Colin From Accounts (The Good Room) S1 (6/8)
programme.desc: «The Good Room»Ashley takes Gordon to her birthday dinner at Lynelle and creepy professor Lee's house.
